name: ITP - Concrete Repairs - NSW
1. General Preliminaries
1.1 - Job Inspection/Scope of works review
Frequency - Prior to each separable parts of the works
Acceptance Criteria - Site Hazards and job specific requirements
Conformance Record - Project Scope/SWMS & Risk Assessment
Responsible Personnel - Supervisor, Crew Foreman Engineer
1.2 - Equipment and vehicles pre-start checks
Frequency - Daily
Acceptance Criteria - As appropriate for items of plant and equipment
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and documentation. Test and Tag. Service History
Conformance Record - Equipment/Heavy Vehicle Maintenance checklist
Responsible Personnel - Plant Operators
1.3 - Toolbox meetings
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works on site
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure all Site hazards are identified
Inspection/Test Method - Physical attendance
Conformance Record - Attendance Record/Sign in Record
Responsible Personnel - Client
2. Concrete Spalling Remediation
2.1 - Site Establishment [(Erection of scaffolding or EWP deployment) If required]
Frequency - After site has been deemed safe and accessible
Acceptance Criteria - Access to repair is safe
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection
Responsible Personnel - ECM supervisor, workers
(R) Review Point
Confirmation of correct temporary solution is established
2.2 - Hammer test intended repair area to identify any further hollow sections or delamination
Frequency - After site is established to grant safe access to repairs
Acceptance Criteria - Sound concrete is achieved in the perimeter
Inspection/Test Method - Physical Application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification M774 - Concrete Bridge Repairs
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor, workers
(W) Witness Point
Confirmation all loose/hollow areas are marked, and sound concrete is reached
2.2 - Square up and break away loose concrete perimeter
Frequency - After Identification of concrete spalling / Cracks as per scope of works
Acceptance Criteria - Area of spalling to be squared with a concrete grinder and min depth achieved shall be 10 - 25mm based on product specification
Inspection/Test Method - Physical Application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification M774 - Concrete Bridge Repairs
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor, workers
2.3 - Treat any corrosion to reinforcement bars (If Applicable) (If rebars are identified, concrete must be broken further back approx. 20mm to allow new concrete to bond with reo)
Frequency - After breaking away loose concrete and debris
Acceptance Criteria - Corrosion is cleaned with wire brush and treated with Nitoprime Zinchrich
Inspection/Test Method - Physical Application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification M774 - Concrete Bridge Repairs
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor workers
(H) HOLD POINT
Confirmation of depth and width is within allowance of product specification, if not notify the principal contractor immediately
HOLD POINT
2.4 - Install Formwork to repair area (If required)
Frequency - After area is prepared as per specs
Inspection/Test Method - Physical Application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification M774 - Concrete Bridge Repairs
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor Workers
2.5 - Saturate Concrete with clean water required by supplier
Frequency - After Formwork Installation
Acceptance Criteria - Saturate according to product supplier
Inspection/Test Method - Physical Application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification M774 - Concrete Bridge Repairs
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor workers
(W) Witness Point
2.6 - Saturate bonding coat (Primer)(If applicable) is to be brushed into damp substrate to receive repair mortar
Frequency - After removal of excess water
Acceptance Criteria - Coat should be done according to product suppliers’ recommendation. Entire substrate should be adequately applied
Inspection/Test Method - Physical Application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification M774 - Concrete Bridge Repairs
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor workers
(W) Witness Point
2.7 - Mix and install repair shrinkage compensated mortar into prepared substrate
Frequency - After bonding coat is applied
Acceptance Criteria - Installation should be done as per the product suppliers’ requirements.
Inspection/Test Method - Physical Application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification M774 - Concrete Bridge Repairs
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor Workers
(W) Witness Point
2.8 - Repair Mortar allowed to cure and treated with an appropriate concrete cure (If Applicable)
Frequency - After repair mortar is placed
Acceptance Criteria - Apply according to AS 3799. Product specifications
Inspection/Test Method - Physical Application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification M774 - Concrete Bridge Repairs
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor workers
(W) Witness Point
3. Concrete Cracking Remediation
3.1 - Mark out cracked to be routed and sealed.
Frequency - Prior to starting any work
Acceptance Criteria - Identification of visual crack on concrete surface
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification TS 00080:1.0 - Repair of Concrete Works
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor, workers
(W) Witness Point
3.2 - Chase crack with a V-Blade grinder to a depth of 15mm
Frequency - After defect has been identified
Acceptance Criteria - Crack has been eliminated and solid concrete has been reached
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification TS 00080:1.0 - Repair of Concrete Works
Responsible Personnel - ECM supervisor, workers
3.3 - Assess the cause of the crack, crack dimensions, and whether the crack is active or inactive
Frequency - After Crack has been chased with a V – Blade
Acceptance Criteria - Determine if the crack is only surface crack, shrinkage crack, or settlement crack
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification TS 00080:1.0 - Repair of Concrete Works.
Responsible Personnel - Ward Civil Engineers
(H) Hold Point
HOLD POINT
Opt 1 - If the concrete adjacent to the crack has deteriorated, the concrete must be treated as a cementitious patch repair of concrete
Frequency - After Crack has been chased with a V – Blade
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete spalling is present
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification TS 00080:1.0 - Repair of Concrete Works. Clause 7.4
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor, workers
Opt 2 - Routing and sealing: Enlarging the crack along its exposed face and filling with a suitable joint sealant.
Frequency - After Crack has been chased with a V – Blade
Acceptance Criteria - Crack is only on the surface and no visible crack is present further past the groove
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical inspection
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification TS 00080:1.0 - Repair of Concrete Works. Clause 7.5
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor, workers
Opt 3 - Gravity feed: Filling and sealing of horizontally positioned cracks using low viscosity resins by pouring and spreading onto surface or placing into purposely formed reservoirs.
Frequency - After Crack has been chased with a V – Blade
Acceptance Criteria - Crack is present past the groove introduced. A low viscosity crack injection shall be used to flood the surface groove
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical application
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification TS 00080:1.0 - Repair of Concrete Works. Clause 7.5
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor, workers

Opt 4 - Coating over cracks: Application of coatings with a crack-bridging capability or impregnation ability (such as silanes) for cracks of width of 0.2 mm or less. The method must be used only for cracks that are compatible with the functional requirements of the structure but are not associated with earth-retaining or water-retaining concrete components.
Frequency - After Crack has been chased with a V – Blade
Acceptance Criteria - Crack is only on the surface and no visible crack is present further past the groove
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical inspection
Conformance Record - TfNSW specification TS 00080:1.0 - Repair of Concrete Works. Clause 7.5
Responsible Personnel - ECM Supervisor, workers
Completion Sign Off
Evolution Civil Maintenance

Final Inspection: I confirm that the above works have been installed in accordance with the specification requirements. Any minor alterations to the standards are stated on the attached Daily Diary or Non-Conformance Report (NCR).
Signature:
ITP - Expansion Joint Install
1. General Preliminaries
1.1 - Job Inspection/Scope of works review
Frequency - Prior to each separable parts of the works
Acceptance Criteria - Site Hazards and job specific requirements
Conformance Record - Project Scope/SWMS & Risk Assessment
Responsible Personnel - Supervisor, Crew Foreman Engineer
1.2 - Equipment and vehicles pre-start checks
Frequency - Daily
Acceptance Criteria - As appropriate for items of plant and equipment
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and documentation. Test and Tag. Service History
Conformance Record - Equipment/Heavy Vehicle Maintenance checklist
Responsible Personnel - Plant Operators
1.3 - Toolbox meetings
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works on site
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure all Site hazards are identified
Inspection/Test Method - Physical attendance
Conformance Record - Attendance Record/Sign in Record
Responsible Personnel - FHEOM
2. Removal of Existing Expansion Joint
2.1 - Review drawings/Work procedure to determine location of joints, width and alignment of the bridge joint.
Frequency - Prior to excavation
Acceptance Criteria - Correct product is applicable in remediation works
Inspection/Test Method - Visual & Physical Inspection
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Civil
(R) (Review Point)
2.2 - Mark out sawcut line with marking paint and stringline ensuring widths meets specifications requirements.
Frequency - After location has been identified
Acceptance Criteria - Marking meets the minimum width requirements.
Inspection/Test Method - Visual & Physical Inspection
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Civil
2.3 - Sawcut along established marked lines and remove all existing materials within new sawcut allowing substrate and blockout to be established.
Frequency - After dimensions has been marked out
Acceptance Criteria - Sawcut is established to reach the edge of the concrete surface
Inspection/Test Method - Visual & Physical Inspection
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Civil
2.4 - The newly established blockout is to be scabbled, grit blasted and air blasted to remove all surface contaminants and deleterious materials
Frequency - Once materials has been fully excavated
Acceptance Criteria - A clean substrate blockout has been established
Inspection/Test Method - Visual & Physical Inspection
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Civil
(H) HOLD POINT
Confirmation of depth and width is within allowance of product specification, if not notify the principal contractor immediately
HOLD POINT
(GRANOR XJS SYSTEM) 3. Installation of new Expansion Joint System
3.1 - Bridge Air Gap is packed out with a suitable size polystyrene sheet to prevent materials falling into air gap.
Frequency - Blockout has been fully prepped
Acceptance Criteria - Blockout is free from any previous contamination
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Witness Point
3.2 - Silspec 900 PNS has been mixed with its Part A and B and 2 bags of aggregate.
Frequency - Once airgap has been packed out
Acceptance Criteria - Product is to be mixed to a minimum of 3 minutes
Inspection/Test Method - Visual Inspection
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Witness Point
3.3 - Silspec is poured into blockout and pounded
Frequency - Once Silspec 900 has been adequately mixed
Acceptance Criteria - Liquid rises to the surface indicating correct installation.
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and Physical application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Witness Point
3.4 - 1-2mm crushed Bauxite is sprinkled onto Silspec 900 for further Anti- Skid resistant
Frequency - Once silspec has been prepared adequately
Acceptance Criteria - Silspec and bauxite has been finished to adjacent surface level
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and Physical application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Witness Point
3.5 - After Silspec 900 is cured, the joint gap work is removed.
Frequency - After Silspec is fully cured (usually 2 hours)
Acceptance Criteria - Form is fully removed
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.6 - Interior faces of the nosing’s are prepped by surface grinding and sand blading and grinded to achieve a chamfer between 5 – 10mm to prevent a weak point of failure
Frequency - Once majority of form is removed
Acceptance Criteria - To establish a clean internal face
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.7 - A suitable size backing rod is inserted in the joint gap to allow 15mm clearance from the surface
Frequency - After all prep works is completed
Acceptance Criteria - Backing rod is at least 25% larger than the existing air gap
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.8 - The surface and sides of the joint gap is painted and allowed to dry to a tacky state with a suitable primer
Frequency - After sandblasting and preparing the internal faces
Acceptance Criteria - Primer dries to a tacky touch feel
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.9 - DC902 is installed on top of the backing rod
Frequency - After all prep works has been completed
Acceptance Criteria - DC902 must be 12mm – 15mm allowing 2 – 3mm step from the surface
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
(APJ Thormajoint) 3. Installation of new Expansion Joint System
3.1 - Joint Gap has been cleaned out and packed with a suitable size Heat Resistant Packing to prevent debris falling into air gap.
Frequency - After joint concrete has been prepared
Acceptance Criteria - Blockout is free of contamination
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.2 - Following the packing of the airgap, bridge joint binder is poured into the recess in the airgap to create the watertight seal
Frequency - After binder has been poured
Acceptance Criteria - Airgap is packed with a heat resistant packing and airgap is filled with binder.
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.3 - The bridging plate is placed over the expansion joint gap. The plate must extend beyond any spalled edges and must lie flat across the airgap with a minimal height difference between the two concrete members.
Frequency - After formwork has been prepared
Acceptance Criteria - Aluminium plate covers entire airgap
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.4 - The joint recess is then tanked out by applying bridge joint binder over all exposed horizontal and vertical faces within the joint.
Frequency - After bridging plate is placed
Acceptance Criteria - Recess blockout is coated with joint binder
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.5 - The binder is heated in a thermostatically controlled boiler in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations typically between 170°C and 190°C. The temperature has been checked using a handheld thermometer.
Frequency - After Joint formwork is removed
Acceptance Criteria - Material temperature is within allowed temperature
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.6 - Each completed mix is poured into the prepared joint trench to form layers of between 50 – 100 mm. If required, each successive layer shall be compacted fully to ensure that the Thormajoint is at its maximum density.
Frequency - After binder has been heated correctly.
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.7 - Following the final layer of compaction, a final screed is required to waterproof the top layer of the joint and to prevent the ingress of other contaminants.
Frequency - After mix is poured
Acceptance Criteria - Final layer is adjacent to existing surface levels
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.8 - The application of Surface Dressing to the surface of the installed joint is recommended to improve the anti-skid quality of the trafficked surface.
Frequency - After final screed is applied
Acceptance Criteria - 1-3mm bauxite is sprinkled to the surface to allow additional anti skid surfacing
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
(Britflex BEJ) 3. Installation of new Expansion Joint System
3.1.1 - If drainage is specified, prime beneath the position of the drainage channel with a mix of the two resin components.
Frequency - After joint concrete has been prepared
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.1.2 - The adjacent road surface shall be taped along the edge of the saw cut on each respective side of the joint to protect the adjacent construction from spillage etc.
Frequency - After drainage has been prepared
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.1.3 - The prepared joint recess shall be primed with a coat of Britflex Resin (no aggregate).
Frequency - After road surface edge has been taped
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.1.4 - The two resin components are warmed in thermostatically controlled oil jacketed heaters with the resin temperature maintained at 60 – 85°C. The resin temperature must not exceed 85°C.
Frequency - After joint recess has been primed
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.1.5 - Once the resins have reached temperature the Base and Hardener Resins are decanted into separate calibrated jugs providing the correct quantities of each resin component per mix. 2.5 kg Base Resin : 1.5 kg Hardener Resin.
Frequency - After resins have been heated to correct temperature
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.1.6 - The resins are added together in a separate mixing container and mixed with a slow speed mixing paddle for 30 seconds to 1 minute until homogenous and streak free.
Frequency - After resins have been separated into correct quantities
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.1.7 - Once suitably mixed the heated and mixed resin is painted onto all exposed surfaces within the joint recess to which the Nosing Mortar will bond.
Frequency - After resins have been mixed correctly
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Assembly of the Joint Rails

3.2.1 - BEJ Joint Rails are to be cut to length to suit conditions and lane configuration to ensure that where possible butt joints between rails are located on lane lines. Where this is not practicable butt joints must be placed in an untrafficked area.
Frequency - After resin has been painted onto joint recess
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.2.2 - The expansion joint gap between the rails is to be set to suit the expansion joint gap within the bridge; or wider as may be required to suit the selected joint type.
Frequency - After joint rails have been cut to length
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.2.3 - The appropriately sized Gap- Setters are selected and installed between the rails to set the new joint gap. The rails are then attached to the strong backs and positioned over the new joint recess.
Frequency - After expansion joint gap has been set
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Forming the Rails Butt Joint
3.3.1 - The Butt Joint between the rails are to be formed to connect the rails along the length of the bridge joint as required.
Frequency - After Gap setters have been selected and installed
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.3.2 - A Single-V butt joint will be used with chamfered edges being formed at 45°. The chamfer will be formed on the top and rear faces of the rails using an angle grinder, with the chamfer having a face of 5 to 10 mm.
Frequency - After Butt Joints have been connected
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.3.3 - Once the rails have been ground to form the chamfer the rails are to be positioned such that there will be no difference between the rails across the butt joint in either plane; vertical or horizontal. Once the alignment is good the rails can be clamped to hold in position before welding.
Frequency - After edges have been chamfered
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.3.4 - A weld is to be formed into the Single-V butt joint across the top and rear faces of the rails. The weld shall be visually inspected to ensure good penetration is achieved
Frequency - Once rails have been clamped
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.3.5 - The welds are then to be carefully ground back to be flush with the rails.
Frequency - Once welds have been completed
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.3.6 - On completion of grinding the weld must again be visually inspected to ensure that sufficient strength is maintained in the weld. The affected area is then to be touched-up with high zinc content cold gal paint.
Frequency - After welds have been ground back
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Alignment of Joint Rails
3.4.1 - The BEJ Rails are positioned along the length of the joint to ensure good alignment over the expansion joint gap.
Frequency - After welds have been visually inspected
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.4.2 - Strong backs and Gap Setters are to be placed at least every metre along the length of the joint.
Frequency - After BEJ rails have been positioned correctly
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.4.3 - The gap width between the rails (measured perpendicularly) must be checked to ensure that the gap width remains within a tolerance of 3 mm over the length of 1 metre.
Frequency - After Strong backs and gap setters have been placed
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.4.4 - The height of the rails must be adjusted to ensure that they are positioned within 0mm to -3mm of the adjacent surfacing.
Frequency - After gap width has been measured and within tolerance
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.4.5 - The joint gap formwork is to be inserted between the rails ensuring that the formwork matches the joint gaps between the rails and is inserted into the joint gap securely within the structure.
Frequency - After the height of the rails have been checked
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Installation of Joint Nosing’s
3.5.1 - The two resin components (Base & Hardener Resin) are warmed in thermostatically controlled oil jacketed heaters with the resin temperature maintained at 60 – 85°C.
Frequency - After joint gap formwork has been inserted
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.5.2 - Once the resins have reached temperature the Base and Hardener Resins are decanted into separate calibrated jugs providing the correct quantities of each resin component per mix. 2.5 kg Base Resin : 1.5 kg Hardener Resin.
Frequency - After resins have been heated to the correct temperature
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.5.3 - The resins are added together in a separate mixing container and mixed with a slow speed mixing paddle for 30 seconds to 1 minute until homogenous and streak free.
Frequency - After resins have been separated into correct quantities
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.5.4 - The pre-batched blend of aggregates is first pre-heated to 70 – 85°C in a forced action mixer using a gas torch. The temperature of the aggregate shall be checked using an infrared non-contact thermometer.
Frequency - After resins have been mixed correctly
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.5.5 - The mixed resin component is added to the aggregate and mixed for 1.5 to 2 minutes until homogenous, and all aggregate particles are thoroughly coated.
Frequency - After the aggregate is at the required temperature throughout
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.5.6 - The resin mortar is poured into the prepared trench in the carriageway and trowelled flush with the rails and surfacing.
Frequency - After mixed resin is added to aggregate and thoroughly coated
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.5.7 - An aggregate dressing is applied to the surface of the nosing to enhance the skid resistance and aesthetic appearance of the nosing.
Frequency - Once resin mortar is poured and levelled
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader

3.5.8 - Curing will be achieved after 2 or 3 hours when the material is installed at 70°C. Adjustments to the temperature of the resin components or heating tunnels may be used to accelerate the curing of the Britflex Resin Mortar.
Frequency - After aggregate dressing is applied
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
Installation of Expansion Joint Seal
3.6.1 - Strong backs and Gap formwork are removed to facilitate the installation of the joint seal.
Frequency - Once the joint has cured
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.6.2 - The expansion joint seals are installed using specially designed tongs to compress and insert the seals throughout.
Frequency - Prior to installing the seal, the joint rails must be visually inspected for damage to the protective coating. Touch up using a high zinc content cold gal paint.
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
3.6.3 - Expansion Joint Seal must be checked to ensure that it is seated correctly and fully engaged within the rails. (Hold Point)
Frequency - On completion of insertion of the joint seals
Inspection/Test Method - Visual and physical Application
Conformance Record - As per Issued for Construction Drawings or consultant design or Manufacturers Recommendation
Responsible Personnel - Evolution Team Leader
